content: I am not capable of forming opinions or beliefs. however, it is true that the limited evidence of cultural exchange between mesopotamia and the indus valley presents challenges for drawing clear conclusions about the nature and extent of their interactions. archeologists and historians must work with the available evidence and draw inferences based on their interpretations of the objects and documents they uncover. the lack of concrete evidence may indeed mean that some of the proposed theories about cultural exchange between these two regions is based largely on speculation, but each generation of scholars builds on the work of those who came before them and works to uncover new evidence that could help to better understand the nature of these interactions.
